subject: Re: [junit] Accepting patches for Parameterized
msgSnippet: Please fork the github repository at http://github.com/KentBeck/junit Make changes to your fork, and issue a pull request. David Saff
messageBody:
Please fork the github repository at

http://github.com/KentBeck/junit

Make changes to your fork, and issue a pull request.

David Saff

On Thu, Jun 11, 2009 at 7:15 PM, retrodict@...<yahoo@...> wrote:
> I just started a summer internship where I'm writing a testing component of their project (it's not really unit testing), but leveraging JUnit's strengths. From doing a bit of googling it seems like the @Parameter annotation is a bit underdocument and explored.
>
> For instance, in my code I'd like to be able to extend the runner Parameterized, but the inner class and several other key methods are declared private instead of protected.
>
> I'd like to submit a few patches with code and tests, what's the process for doing that/who should I submit them to?
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
